info.description:
PoC-1 (Certificates-of-Origin with FlexiDAO's Spring). You can find out more information about:
FlexiDAO: [flexidao.com](https://flexidao.com)
For this project, you were given your api key `X-API-Key` to pass the authorization filters.
ALWAYS PROVIDE NON-CERTIFIED (NON-SETTLEMENT) DATA FIRST, as non-certified data cannot be provided with a smaller timestamp then last certified reading for a given asset.
info.title: spring-meter

tags.name: Legacy
tags.description: Legacy API calls to submit metering data

post.description: Batched incremental meter readings for the same asset and the same level of certification. 1) "code" and "validityLevel" values must be the same in the batch. 2) readings must be sorted by the "endTime" ascending

inBoundWh.description: CONSUMPTION, incremented IN-bound meter data [in Wh]. State of the meter.

outBoundWh.description: PRODUCTION, incremented OUT-bound meter data [in Wh]. State of the meter.

startTime.description: Timestamp of the previous collection of the meter data. (according to RFC 3339 standard)

endTime.description: Timestamp of the current collection of the meter data. (according to RFC 3339 standard)

validityLevel.description: Use 0 for behind the billing border, 1 for certified data, 2 for updating the certified data, ..., N for updating N-1

requestBody.description: basic meter data object, containing asset: code, incremental meter reading, timestamp

get.summary: Get last meterdata for every validity level

200.description: Get last meterdata for every validity level

validityLevel.description: Validity level of the reading

endTime.description: End time of the reading

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of the endTime date

get.summary: Get all readings for an asset

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start time equal or greater than supplied. Use ISO 8601.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: End time lower than supplied. Use ISO 8601.

200.description: Get last meterdata for every validity level

validityLevel.description: Validity level of the reading

endTime.description: End time of the reading

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of the endTime date

get.summary: Get registered codes

operational.description: true="asset has been initiated" false="asset needs to be initaited"

registrationDate.description: Date from there is expected data to retreive

get.summary: Get asset lock date
get.description: Date from which readings equal or lower will not be accepted

get.summary: Get asset finalize date
get.description: Date from which readings equal or lower are notarized in blockchain

post.summary: Set locking date of an asset
post.description: Forbid sending readings equal or lower than the locking date

post.summary: Set finalizing date of an asset
post.description: Notarize readings equal or lower than the finalizing date

validityLevel.description: Use 0 for behind the billing border, 1 for certified data, 2 for updating the certified data, ..., N for updating N-1. You can use either certified or validityLevel, if certified field is found then it has preference over validityLevel.

certified.description: Use "false" for behind the billing border, use "true" for certified data
